item.title: Common programming paradigms overview
item.description: Programming paradigms are ways of programming that are reflected in language features. They tell us which structures to use and when to use them. There are 3 such main paradigms: structured programming object-orient programming functional programming. Most languages are multi-paradigm but levels of restrictions/enforcing can be different. For example, both Java and Scala support object-orient and functional programming. At the same time level of enforcement of the functional paradigm in Scala is much higher.
